website_summaries.verdict: This compact model is designed to offer corded power to users who have occasional moderate-sized cutting jobs at their household.
pros: At a lightweight 8 pounds, this model is easy for most to maneuver, and is compact enough to make cuts in tight spaces
Small size stores easily when not in use
The 8-amp motor may not be powerful enough for large tree trunks, but can handle almost any limb on an average tree, as well as thick hedges or undergrowth
cons: This chainsaw is designed for occasional household use, and frequent use on larger jobs may cause the chain to come off or the chainsaw to wear out quickly

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste you time or money!
customer_reviews.text: I was born on a farm and have been using chainsaws since I was 9 or 10 years old. As farmers we cut and sold firewood for a living every winter. I just used this chainsaw for the first time today. I started about an hour ago and have spent more time fixing the chain than cutting. I have not went more than 3 or 4 minutes without having to adjust the bar or completely remove it to tighten and reinstall the chain. Definitely WOULD NOT recommend this saw!
customer_reviews.author: T Hestand

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased as a gift but I own one and love it. No gas miixture to deal with
customer_reviews.text: This saw as purchased as a gift but I own one and love it. No gas miixture to deal with, much less noise to deal with, and it’s powerful enough to take care of any chainsaw needs and requirements around the house. This is very useful little saw. I love it and several other Worx tools I own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This will not do whats expected of it
customer_reviews.text: I bought it new and got it ready to cut a 3 inch round tree trunk and it failed miserably after the second cut. The blade couldn't cut except to smoke. Blade dulled very quickly. Cumbersome to use and not really safe. I will never buy this product ever again. Very disappointing on the performance especially on such an easy task.
customer_reviews.author: ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ

customer_reviews.title: good saw
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time today to cut off a limb that went down. I was surprised at how good it is.You are limited by the length of the cord but otherwise it will do anything that the big chain saws will do.
customer_reviews.author: karl

customer_reviews.title: For small compact chainsaw cutting up to 3 inches works ...
customer_reviews.text: For small compact chainsaw cutting up to 3 inches works flawlessly. Keep in mind gonna take the blade off clean the housing and the flywheel after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Ace1963

customer_reviews.title: After working with this Chain saw for a whole season ...
customer_reviews.text: After working with this Chain saw for a whole season ... I highly recomend it .
customer_reviews.author: G. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Runs smoothly with little or no vibration
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and lightweight. Cuts well and has all the safety protection incorporated into the design. Cut through a 8" brank in to time flat.
customer_reviews.author: dcwuellner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a very petite woman to use. Thank you! Buy extra chains :)
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Waltman

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: This little chain saw is great and even cut a big tree that had fallen in my yard
customer_reviews.author: Marie Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Good Saw at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: The saw came as described. Very fast shipping. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice little chainsaw that gets the job done for the few times I need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: Always check bar and chain oil,,
customer_reviews.text: Works great,, is exactly what I was looking for, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but was very easy to put back on
customer_reviews.text: Cut a medium sized tree with it. Worked well. Just make sure you check chain tightness every couple minutes. Chain came off once, but was very easy to put back on. No tools required.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WG 305 14" chainsaw, Cut great nice and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: I got my Worxs WG 305 yesterday, Cut some tree branches today for about 2 hours.(45 minutes work time for the saw) it cut great. Just let it let operate at its own pace. Only problem is the chain jumped off twice, Hope it doesn't continue and if so i hope it doesn't break the plastic. Maybe it will stretch out and stay on (Fingers Crossed). It is nice and light weight and it ate right through 4' tree branches. I like the electric instead of gas, Pull the trigger and it starts up every time. great around the home no pulling a starter rope.
customer_reviews.author: interested party

customer_reviews.title: Chain-tightener is lousy
customer_reviews.text: This saw has good balance, simple and easy to hold. It has enough power to cut trees and downed logs up to the length of its bar and even more if you're patient. The problem I have is the chain adjustment because once saw shavings get into the case and they always do they interfere with the ability to adjust the bar. As a result it's hard to sustain a properly tightened chain. Mine has come off the bar a few times now and I'm always removing the cover, cleaning it out and re-tightening. It's not a convenience, it's a pain.
customer_reviews.author: S. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use chainsaws quite often and got this as a backup. While it's powerful enough and very lightweight the auto-chain tension system failed to keep the chain properly adjusted. After so many cuts the chain would go slack and I'd need to manually re-adjust it each time which was very frustrating. It would be a decent chainsaw if it wasn't for that.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Light weight low noise powerful tool for small to medium job
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw is veru light weight, low motor noise and moderately powerful. I took down a whole small tree with it. You can continuously work for hours. If you used to use the gas saw, you ll feel the difference in weight and power. Very low kick back. Highly recommended. Again its ideal for a small to medium size job. Not recommended where you ve to climb the tree because of its hazzard of using extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: pro review

customer_reviews.title: Owned and used for 4 years. Use to bury dog fence wire and cut roots out of pole footings.
customer_reviews.text: This was would not be my first choice for firewood, but that is not why I use it. I have used this saw for miles of invisible dog fence wire. Wire only needs to be buried a few inches. Saw easily cuts roots along the way. I also use it when digging footings for pole barn, garages, sheds etc. Quickly cuts large roots out of way. New chains are inexpensive, but will last a long way, when drenching in dirt. Easily fence in several acres with one chain.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Chain constantly come loose...
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money unless you want to spend more time messing with the chain than with sawing anything. The chain constantly comes loose and/or off with even the lightest use and then you have to pull the cover off and reinstall it, trying to get it as tight as possible. You then keep your fingers crossed that you can saw a few more branches before it slips off again. The chain simply doesn't maintain adequate tension. My manual pruning tools do a better, faster and cleaner job that this piece of trash. I threw my money away on this one but I won't be fooled again.
customer_reviews.author: JRB

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I didn't expect much, but for 40 bucks on sale, it's amazing. One proble.m with it is that the bar oiler stop.s workin.g after a while. I leaks bar oil when it's sitting, but I can't get the oiler to work even after cleaning ALL the cavities out.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard and auto tensioner does not work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this wg305 14 inch model at walmart after being a bit sceptical about the reviews and..... The reviews dont lie. The box states the saw can cut up 28inches. I tried to cut a 11 inch tree and after every cut i had to take the chain tensioner off and put it back on. The auto tensioner was not working. After 5 cuts, the saw started to smoke. After inspection, the bottom of the chainsaw motor was melting out the bottom. i immediately returned the chainsaw back to walmart and the manager returned it with no questions and stated they would file a fire hazard complaint about the device.
customer_reviews.author: TechCheetah

customer_reviews.title: For $50.00, one should not expect much, but at least the chain should stay on the bar when one is doing light duty cutting.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! The chain will not stay on the bar even in very light duty/pruning sawing conditions. The auto tensioner mechanism does not appear to be working. Plus, it leaks bar oil all over when the saw is set down on a flat surface. The saw is a nice weight and handles well when the chain stays on.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Braden

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this saw for about a year and it does everything I have asked of it. This includes sawing up an 18 inch ash tree that fell in my yard. You need to be able to sharpen it, I use a Dremel tool with a diamond bit. The blade does need tension adjustment but so does my stilh 170 and Husqvarna 350.
customer_reviews.author: John Birk

customer_reviews.title: Good saw on the cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used once-I cut 5 pressure treated poles-worked like a little charm so far. Sharp, quik, easy to work with in my tight space. Just handy. Cheap, so if it doesn't last a long time im ok. It is not for huge jobs but cut 8" poles no prob.
customer_reviews.author: Lynden

customer_reviews.title: Rock and Roll chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I got this chainsaw because I needed to spend some expiring reward points on a credit card. Hmmm, I needed to trim some plumeria trees at home, skeptical on whether an electric cheap chainsaw could do much, but hey - it was a utilitarian choice amongst all the other limited choices I had on their list. THIS SAW ROCKS!! It more than handled the job. I am amazed at the quality and how it handled. It may be the best one I ever used, gas or electric.
customer_reviews.author: jabberwocky

customer_reviews.title: NO AUTO TENSION!
customer_reviews.text: Had the larger model with no issues, so I thought this one would be good too..........WRONG! There is no auto tension like it's big brother. The chain will fall off and no way to properly tension the blade. A call to WORX tried to tell me their is auto tension, and I asked how to do it and the rep went to get their saw to tell me and replied with you are correct...NO TENSION ADJUSTMENT! Do not buy, or you will be sorry...
customer_reviews.author: Virginia-Jim

customer_reviews.title: Ideal saw for small jobs. Ideal for the money...
customer_reviews.text: It cuts nicely adn smoothly. Chain has to be tensioned time to time, but no problems with oil consumption. Ideal for small jobs - like one I did: had a pine tree fall; I cut it into small logs in about 1.5hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Magnetostatic

customer_reviews.title: That is the best one at all
customer_reviews.text: That is the best one at all. I have judge experience and I have changer a lots of chainsaw because of their short life. That is the one which lasted for more than one year and I still use it. Absolutely the best !
customer_reviews.author: Misho

customer_reviews.title: Value for the money
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews are spot on. The chain does come off, it does leak oil a bit. But when it comes to sawing off branches it does a good job. I had to adjust the chain several times but overall no problems. I really needed it for just a small job, and I am glad I not spend a lot. This saw did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell Gee

customer_reviews.title: Junk by Worx
customer_reviews.text: Same problem as all the others. Wish I'd read the reviews before buying it at LOWE'S (what are they thinking, stocking junk like this? It doesn't reflect well on their decision making). The chain came off three times while cutting seven small (five-inch) logs. Back to Lowe's it goes, and how does that help their bottom line??? And how does it help the Worx brand to put out annoying crud like this? I'll try the Earthwise CS30116 with its 4.6-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Tumbleweed

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw for the average homeowner
customer_reviews.text: Love this little chainsaw. Great product chain never fell off once. It does have a chain tightner not automatic. Chewed threw my branches like a beaver !
customer_reviews.author: Roland K.

customer_reviews.title: Ugh
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the issue is here but the cain and bar don't stay together very well. Its a light duty chainsaw not intended for anything a hatchet couldnt handle in ny opinion
customer_reviews.author: GouldStorm

customer_reviews.title: Oil leaks very common
customer_reviews.text: Oil leaks with Worx chain saws are a very common problem beware.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie Zhindon-Corin

customer_reviews.title: There are better choices.
customer_reviews.text: Spent more time putting the chain on than cutting. In 10 minutes chain came off 3 times. There are better choices. S
customer_reviews.author: stephen thomas

product_meta.title: WORX WG305 Electric Chain Saw, 14-Inch
product_meta.description: The WORX chainsaw is a compact powerhouse. It offers a powerful 8 Amp motor in a lightweight and efficient 14-inch design. This low-maintenance chainsaw has a patented auto-tensioning chain system to help extend the life of the bar and chain. In addition, the automatic, tool-free chain tensioning system and oil level indicator makes it even easier to operate and maintain. This 14-inch compact powerhouse, has a comfortable rubberized over grip handle to improve comfort and stability. The WORX chainsaw is easy to use for light to medium duty trimming, limbing, pruning, and clean up around the yard
feature_bullets: Patented auto-tension chain system for extended Bar & chain life
Powerful 8 amp motor offers a consistent performance. No-load speed (RPM)
Chain lubrication with oil lever indicator
4 fl oz fuel capacity - 8 A - AC supply powered

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars66 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
